website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering for those who prefer a smaller eye mask with complete coverage, but it's best to use it without the ill-fitting strap.
pros: Provides a nice design for sufferers of headaches and migraines, as it's not too large or heavy on the face
No eye holes to let in light
Gel beads conform to facial contours
cons: The strap is flimsy and tends to fit too tightly
Mixed opinions on the duration it maintains heat or cold
Not for wearers who prefer eye holes

customer_reviews.title: Mostly air.
customer_reviews.text: Only 1/3 of the mask had beads in it, it was mostly just air. I'd be happy to submit a photo. This issue has been reported by many other reviewers but I was hoping it wouldn't be the case for me. Great idea, poor design. Update: They did replace my mask, so I'm updating my review 1 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Peck

customer_reviews.title: Great for my puffy eyes
customer_reviews.text: I really love this face mask. I like to use it cold. I'm getting older and the "sleep" is taking longer to go away from my eyes. What I do is wash my face with my beauty care products. I'll put the mask on my eyes until it starts to melt. You can immediately see the puffiness go away. I do this everyday! Once I take the mask off, I continue getting ready by applying my serum, my moisturizer, and eye care products. I love that the puffiness around my eyes goes down right away and I am able to get ready and look fresh quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Naty

customer_reviews.title: If you have dry eyes...
customer_reviews.text: This is something you definitely need. My doctor had me using wet clothes on my eyes to help with the dryness I have been experiencing. I was so tired of the drippy mess and how quickly the clothes got cool. I tried other eye masks, but this has been by far the best in offering a moist, warm heat. I found it needed a few seconds longer in the microwave, but with the newer model (I have two now) the beads change color so that you can see if the mask is ready. The heat has helped my eyes so much, and I love that it is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Newton, Ma

customer_reviews.title: Poor outcome
customer_reviews.text: I found I needed to use the strap to get the mask to sit next to my eyes, and it pressed into my eyes. I tried laying it over a damp wash cloth and that was a little better, but not optimal. My eyes were more irritated after using this, I tried both the warm and cold uses. I would not recommend this. Warm soaks with a wash cloth and a bowl of warm water (for warm compresses) or a bag of frozen peas (for cold compresses) works significantly better for me.
customer_reviews.author: AIWWM

customer_reviews.title: Looks like black mold grew inside!
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine, then I discovered a black discoloration INSIDE the mask. Looks like mold to me. Although the problem is inside and doesn't touch the eye, I lost trust in the product. I would expect the inside to be sterile and/or to not discolor. It was used properly, never not overheated, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Filmguy

customer_reviews.title: Provides soothing relief for eye puffiness. Beaded interior allows ...
customer_reviews.text: Provides soothing relief for eye puffiness. Beaded interior allows mask to hug the curves of your face, creating an even coverage. Retains heat for 5-10 minutes and coldness for 4-8 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: coolitbrittneyTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Great for headaches!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from migraines, but I hate to be popping pills every day, I know all of them come with side effects on the long run and I prefer to avoid them. Along with a natural rub for your forehead and neck, I use this mask that I keep in the freezer. It work really good for me, and it alleviates the presure in my head. It can be a cold shock when you first put it on but I usually get used to it fairly quickly. It also works for puffy and tired eyes, to reduce the swelling and redness.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana D

customer_reviews.title: Very flexible
customer_reviews.text: I have a condition called "dry eye" and need to apply warm compress to my eyes twice daily. I had a less costly gel bead mask that became stiff after a year or so. It would no longer fit the contour of my face. This Thera Pearl eye mask seems to be of much better quality and fits my face contours very well. I’m glad I purchased this product.
customer_reviews.author: Papa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I now have 3 Thera Pearl products and love them all. I started using one immediately for my eyes after a serious bout of eyestrain recently and figured there had to be one designed for eyes. It's flexible, light weight, convenient, and cold enough without being too cold (like ice wrapped in a washcloth, my first remedy). I may buy a second one for my eyes, to keep one cold and ready if I forget to put the other back into the freezer immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: I bought this eye mask instead of the buckwheat sack because it looked pretty nice. The mask heats up in 12 seconds ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the eye mask because my eyes get quite dry at night and a few optometrists I've seen said that the issue is that my tears are watery because the oil my eyes produce is thick. They suggested 20 minutes a night with a hot buckwheat sack. I bought this eye mask instead of the buckwheat sack because it looked pretty nice. The mask heats up in 12 seconds in my microwave, which I really like. I don't think the mask holds its heat for 20 minutes though. 15 minutes maybe. I have noticed some improvement and think it's a good mask, but I won't be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Review from a Dry Eye Sufferer-Okay Mask, Smells Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The new masks have a sweet smell to it. Yuck. If you are using this for Blepharitis or MGD, then this is a diaster. Most specialists think there is an allergy and inflammation connection. Artificial scents are a big no-no, especially right up against your eyes. These masks are soft and pliable the first week or so, then they start to harden. I replace it every month. I didn't mind so much, until the smell. That's a deal breaker and I'm off to look for a new mask.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Grapes

customer_reviews.title: Migraines, sinus, allergies
customer_reviews.text: This has been very useful for eye swelling, and for recovery from dental surgery. I flipped it over and wore it more like a surgical mask, or just held it to my face. It's small enough that you can adapt it to the curves of your head, and while it doesn't block out all the light, it's very comforting for swollen eyes, sinus trouble, or for migraine treatment. It doesn't last as long as a bigger ice pack, but it's also not so cold that you need to worry about frostbite. The "pearls" seem to do their job, are comfortable, and none of them have burst despite my tendency to fidget.
customer_reviews.author: wheelchairgirl

customer_reviews.title: Well built product with double use...both cold and warm therapy.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it is hard for me to put on as it wants to flip around when putting on but it is no big deal. I freeze it and then use it cold as I am on a chemo that has eye itching and watering so it gives great relief along with a Claritin. My husband uses his warmed in microwave as he has Dry Eye Syndrome in one eye and it gives him some relief.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Nugent

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs Freezer Smells
customer_reviews.text: I only tried it cold. Feels pretty good, but it absorbed food smells from my fridge so badly I can't use it any more. I placed it in a plastic bag and put it on the door away from food as much as possible but it smells horrible now. Also my freezer does not smell, I don't have problems with anything else absorbing smells.
customer_reviews.author: Asia49

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it does
customer_reviews.text: This works for exactly what I need. I use the eye mask to reduce puffy eyes, so I stick it in the freezer and wear it for 15 minutes. The only potential problem with this is I think the liquid inside the mask turns into condensation when I take it out of the freezer. It's kind of an unpleasant feeling when I wear a wet mask. Oh well, it still works well for the money. I haven't tried heating it, but I think that's a feature more for the other products offered, not for the eye mask.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but Gets Warm in a Few Minutes
customer_reviews.text: I really like this, and it changes color when it’s no longer warm; however, it gets warm within about 5 minutes, so it doesn’t last as long as other ice packs. Other than wishing it stayed cold longer, it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: MarissaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Really tight
customer_reviews.text: I have really bad dry eye, and normally I just use a hot washcloth, but it doesn't stay hot for long, so I figured I would try this. I just got done using it for the first time, and could only stand it for about 10 minutes. There is way too much pressure in my eyes, and now my vision is pretty blurry. I guess I should have removed the mask sooner. I may try it again with a rag between the unit and my eyes, but so far I am glad I only wasted 10 bucks. If I could adjust the strap it would probably work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Duff

customer_reviews.title: A very useful health aide.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful health aide. By heating it up and laying it on your eyes you ensure that the oil glands in your eyelids are kept open and free. This prevents your eyelids from getting infected and from stretching.from blocked oil glands. Instead of using a warm potato for one eye at a time, this health aidee allows you to both eyes atvthe same time thus saving time.
customer_reviews.author: R. Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version of this, and this one is far superior. My old one popped because it was left in the microwave too long. This one indicates when it is time to take it out, the beads are bigger, and the actual eye mask is a much thicker, higher quality material. It doesn’t stay as hot as I like for long, but if you move the beads around inside it heats back up.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: TheraPearl reusable eye mask
customer_reviews.text: I found them to be EXTREMELY cold, much colder than other reusable eye masks. Definitely put a cloth or something with more than one layer between the mask and the skin. EDIT: This is very small compared to other brands that I have bought over time after this one ... it covers your eyes only. If you are looking for one that covers your eyebrows or temples or sinuses or anywhere other than your eyes, then this product is not for you. I thought is was a reasonable size until I found other reusable eye masks.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Wingfield

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been having eye irritation problems and they later get puffy, so I looked up some solutions that didn't involve me putting stuff in my eyes. I decided to go with a gel eye mask and it works! But not only are my eyes no longer irritated nor puffy, but it feels extremely relaxing! I love this product and I would DEFINITELY recommend this to anyone just looking for relaxation or puffy eyes
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: I only use it for cold. It's been great.
customer_reviews.text: As stated, I don't heat it up, so this is only a review for it as a cold pack. Bought it about 2 weeks ago. I've used it pretty much daily. It gets cold quickly, in about 2-3 hours. It stays cold for about 5-8 minutes. The plastic design is a little hard on your face, but it's not uncomfortable. Just don't expect it feel like satin. The product itself is a little delicate. I handle it carefully so as not to damage the cooling balls inside, which are quite squishy. There are enough balls inside to cover and mostly fill the entire mask end to end. For < $15, would absolutely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over earlier model
customer_reviews.text: I like this version better, it form fit well to my eye sockets instead of laying across my face. color change between hot and cold is helpful feature too.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great for dry eyes
customer_reviews.text: Doc prescribed one for me after lasik to help warm and loosen blocked oil glands in eye lid and help with dry eyes. Beware this will cause you blurred vision with the extra eye oil the first few times you use so microwave 20 sec and use before going to sleep at night...comforting and relaxing. I have bought many of these for friends. Have used for 1.5yrs, long lasting!
customer_reviews.author: John Yamada

customer_reviews.title: Relaxing!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this mask. I have dry eyes and my doc told me to use it several times a time. Heats up in about 8 - 10 seconds and the pearls turn white. The heat is so relaxing you must be careful not to fall asleep, especially in the morning 😃. The heat, for me, is usually over in about 10 minutes. Best 10 minutes of my day!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to warm my eyes as recommended by my eye doctor for extremely dry eyes. Works every well and stay warm after puting it in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Novak

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality; Spend the extra dollar elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this product is extremely cheap. The plastic containing the pearls is very thin and weak. When I microwaved this, the product ballooned 4 times its regular size and nearly exploded. The pearls themselves pop very easily if you microwave just a second over the recommended time. So, by my first use, half the pearls were gone. Seeing how thin the plastic is and how easily the pearls popped, I felt it was not really save to put this on my eyes. Spend the extra dollar to buy a more quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Macy

customer_reviews.title: Helped my allergy symptoms!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mask! I've tried similar masks before, but they feel still and uncomfortable after freezing. This mask is still pliable and stayed on my face well so there was no constant adjusting even if I was moving around. My favorite part was the color changing beads so you know what approximate temperature the mask is. I used this for allergy symptoms as I'm allergic to my cat. In the summer despite taking medicine my eyes are nearly always dry and itchy. This mask absolutely helped my symptoms and looks like it will be making my summer much better!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: THERA Pearl eye mask works great!
customer_reviews.text: It's super easy to clean and dry after every use, takes less time in the microwave to heat up, and the strap is removable! There is a trick to getting the bridge of the nose just right so the seamed edge doesn't dig in, but once you figure it out, you're set! Easier to use, clean and dry than traditional rice/pellet eye masks (which take 24 hrs to dry). Been using an eye mask twice per day for 9 months now, THERA Pearl eye mask is the easiest, cleanest and most comfortable way to go!
customer_reviews.author: SensativeSkin

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these eye masks! I wear one to go to bed every night, and when I wake up in the morning my eyes are never puffy. They also help soothe itchy or tired eyes due to allergies. Originally I just bought one, but I loved it so much that I bought a second so I can rotate them in and out of my freezer. Thinking about getting a third!
customer_reviews.author: Paige Heymann

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Great ... sorry!
customer_reviews.text: I get these blocked glands on my eyelids. Warm compresses reduces the swelling. My doctor said to try TheraPearl Eye Mask as it would hold the heat longer than a wash cloth. Cocsistent heat to the affected area is key to recovery. TheraPearl Eye Mask Is an “ok” product...nothing special. Using a warm wash cloth is just as good, if not better. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Schwedor

customer_reviews.title: Eye saver
customer_reviews.text: I have dry eyes. I have to wear night ointment in my eyes. I kept rubbing the ointment out. This caused major problems for me. Then I purchased this mask. It kept my eyes shut and the ointment in. The only issue with this mask is that the strap is very narrow. It would be more comfortable with a thicker strap.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Brown

customer_reviews.title: I was pretty disappointed by these masks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these because I frequently suffer from migraines, which primarily effect my eyes. I was pretty disappointed by these masks. While the beads are very conformable, I feel like the overall shape of the mask put too much pressure on my eyes. Even when I removeded the strap the thick plastic of the eye mask just hurt my eyes and did nothing to sooth my migraine. I also felt that this did not stay cold long enough.
customer_reviews.author: MissMiss

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mask to wear while sleeping after eyelid surgery. I couldn't use it because when I strapped it on it put too much pressure on my eyes. there was no way to loosen it up enough to make it comfortable to use. Very disappointing. I had to resort to the frozen bags of peas. It may work for someone that just wants to use it to prevent eye puffiness but not for post surgical purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: This is a cool concept but the materials are really cheap plastic and cheap elastic
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is more of a gimmick rather than somethign that is actually usable. Its made of cheaply made plastic and It's quite uncomfortable. I would have rather had something made of a soft cotton that was microwaveable rather than something that is uncomfortbale like this.
customer_reviews.author: Breakfast & Munchies

customer_reviews.title: It's cool comforting on my eyes and helps reduce puffiness
customer_reviews.text: I leave in refrig all day, then wear at night. It's cool comforting on my eyes and helps reduce puffiness. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until one of the seams developed a leak and the gel beads started coming out. Fortunately, it wasn't too messy. I threw away the beads that fell out and taped up the hole. Still able to microwave it and hopefully it will be usable for awhile longer.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaLis

customer_reviews.title: Squishy sleep please
customer_reviews.text: First of all, let me start by saying it’s very squishy and I love that. The only issue I have with it is every time I try to put it on my head the strap snaps off. Then I have to rebutton it and put it back on. That’s frustrating. But other than that it’s amazing. Just what I needed. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tandi K.

customer_reviews.title: Great help for dry and tired eyes
customer_reviews.text: Really helps ease eye strain and helps with dry eye syndrome. Would be more comfortable with a cloth outer sheath, but is easy to clean. I usually put it in the microwave for about 20 seconds, and get about 20 minutes to a half hour of heat for my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: surrealist14

customer_reviews.title: Great Mask
customer_reviews.text: I have blepharitis and have to press my eyelids and use a mask every day followed by a foam cleanser. This mask is great in soothing your eyes. I also helps me a lot with my migraines too.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Girl

customer_reviews.title: I use this mask regularly. It’s awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mask regularly. It’s absolutely amazing. I am considering buying a second so that I can use one for hot and one for cold. I bought this item specifically for headaches, and it works really well. It’s also a great way to rest your eyes after staring at a screen all day.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Decent eye mask, cold doesn't last as well.
customer_reviews.text: eye mask feels great when it's first applied but seems to lose it's coldness dissipates a little quicker than expected and doesn't block out light as much as I'd like. There's also no adjustment for the strap so it may be tight for people with big heads or a lot of hair.
customer_reviews.author: jedijay

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this eye mask!!!! Whenever I am stressed out or my eyes hurt or are swollen, I take it out of the freezer and put it on my eyes and it is like I am at a spa! I have also put it in the microwave before and I like that as well, but putting it in the freezer is my favorite. It works so well, I would highly recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Barber

customer_reviews.title: Doctor Recommends
customer_reviews.text: My mother had her cataracts removed and the Dr. recommended the eye mask for her eyes. I have ordered two already from Amazon for her. She said they work great on her eyes and ease of use. Overall, she is satisfied with the product. Will order some more if needed.
customer_reviews.author: IMDante

customer_reviews.title: Would like it better if strap was adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: The band is too tight for me, and didn't feel well using this for migraine pain on my eyes when it was iced. I ended up using this like a head band to ice the top of my head or the back of my neck for migraine pain. The band still felt too tight though, wish it came in different lengths. The strap material feels and works like the straps that came with old school bathing caps. I haven't tired using it with heat yet. You need to be careful not to overheat it otherwise the material will break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I find that the strap for this is too small ...
customer_reviews.text: I find that the strap for this is too small and it presses the eye mask uncomfortably hard into my eyes, which is not soothing at all. After I replaced the strap this was what I was looking for, however.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it seems like it would do wonders for eye pressure and headaches
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I’ve been having issues with swollen eyes and sinus pressure behind my eyes. Upon arrival of this product, the mask had a tear in it to the point where the internal product could be squeezed out. Unfortunately, I was not able to try it out for risk of the product getting in my eyes. Otherwise, it seems like it would do wonders for eye pressure and headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Kellee Burke

customer_reviews.title: Good and comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: This item fits me well. I'm not a big person and the fit was neither too tight or too loose. I saw several complaints about the amount of beads in the packet; however, I found mine (12/2016) to be just fine. Heating and cooling takes hardly any time and I can work with it without any real fuss. I use mine for assisting with eye drops and medication for several minutes before going off to sleep. I actually fell asleep with it on once.
customer_reviews.author: Kapow

customer_reviews.title: Can’t live without this
customer_reviews.text: I love this eye mask. It’s soothing and relaxing. I heat it up and put it on right before bed and it soothes my tired eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia S.

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: It works on both heat or cold as said. Follow the instructions carefully when hearing. Seems to last longer staying cold than hot but really does it's designed for. Comfortable. Can't see anything when it's on though so prepare to relax
customer_reviews.author: Ally J

customer_reviews.title: Great for headaches, allergies, and puffy eyes!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with my purchase. I keep this mask in the freezer and it provides a few minutes great relief and comfort. Great quality for the price, just make sure you handle with care and you shouldn't have a problem. I find it better to put in a plastic bag when you put it in the freezer for added protection. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Nick D

customer_reviews.title: nice alternative to those chemical bomb bead filled fabric masks
customer_reviews.text: Works really well -super easy to use -easy to clean -15 seconds in microwave & up to 10minutes of comfortable heat-also changes color with temperature.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Nice when I have a headache or migraine that feels ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice when I have a headache or migraine that feels like it's behind my eyes and has the added bonus of blocking out excess light so as not to worsen my light-sensitive migraines. I wrap it in a thin towel (like a dish towel) at first because it does get very cold with frozen, but after a few minutes it's fine to put directly over my eyes without the towel. Also it's kind of fun to squish around and play with the beads inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You don't need a microwave!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this product because I don't have a microwave and was apprehensive it would work but I found if I bring a pot of water to a boil (enough to let the mask float) then drop it in for 60-99 seconds, take it out with a wooden spoon, set it on a towel and wipe it down - it's almost the perfect temp. For about 10 min of heat on your eyes before it cools down! My fear is it will wear out quicker when I boil it (almost everyday) but I'd definitely get another one if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This fell apart when I took it out of it packaging. My husband put it back together and when I tried to put it on it a part came off and flung across the room. I tried to have just lay across my eyes but the area that is suppose to cover the eyes was too small to completely cover my eyes. My 8 year old liked to play with it. I didn't try to make it cold or hot I didn't see the point. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone unless they have small close together eyes, and can be extra gentle when handling it.
customer_reviews.author: K. L.

customer_reviews.title: Also the strap is pretty short and not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need to leave it out of the freezer for a few minutes before putting it on your face -- it's way too cold at first!! Also the strap is pretty short and not adjustable...I have a pretty small head but it was really tight on me. You can take the strap off, and I assume buy a different sized strap, but this product only comes with one short one. With the combination of the pack being very cold and the strap being very tight, it definitely was not as relaxing to wear as I was hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nose Bridge Area Broke and Spilled Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I used this mask to help reduce some of the black circles I have under my eyes, and it served that purpose well. However, after a few weeks of use, the part over the nose began to show minor signs of wear and eventually split, causing the beads to spill out . I reached out to THERA°PEARL for a refund, and they did respond. Cheap mask, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: nimm45

customer_reviews.title: Heats up and cools down quickly
customer_reviews.text: Heats up pretty darn hot... but then once it gets to the bearable temperature range, temp tends to fall pretty quickly. I need to put it on my eyes for at least 10 minutes to treat blepharitis, and it needs to be hot enough to dissolve sebaceous fats glommed around my eyelashes (sorry for TMI) and I don't think it stays in that fat-melting range for quite long enough. But it's nicely constructed, comfortable, the beads are really neat. Watch out, the stretchy band to hold it on your face can sometimes snap off and whack you if you're not careful with it. It snaps right back on again, but those snaps could be constructed a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: KatclimberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: It's a little smaller than I thought it was going to be. I also had to take a this cloth between it and my skin as it tended to "stick" on the tender skin around my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses these on her tired old eyes. They get really cold in the freezer, but are soft on the eyes due to the beads. The Amazon description was very clear and accurate. The Amazon customer reviews were helpful. It was well packaged and arrived on schedule.

customer_reviews.title: That is one of the worst things you can do to your eyes IS PUT ...
customer_reviews.text: this thing puts a lot of pressure on your eyeballs when you wear it. That is one of the worst things you can do to your eyes IS PUT PRESSURE ON THEM! Bad design, if the design of the mask did not put any pressure on your eyes, it would get a 5/5, but since all the pressure is forced on your eyes, it actually creates strain. Good idea with the thera pearls, but your design is really bad.
customer_reviews.author: Hidden In the Jungle

customer_reviews.title: Tiny eye mask - not like the picture
customer_reviews.text: The eye mask is tiny. It will cover your eyes, but not much of the skin surrounding it. Also, since it is tiny, it presses down on your eyeballs which really isn't good. Needed something that would cover more of the skin (the bags) under the eye.
customer_reviews.author: Catalicious

customer_reviews.title: Good therapy device.
customer_reviews.text: Stays warm for about 15 minutes & easy to clean. Elastic is still holding up after 6 months, albeit a little flimsy feeling. Instructions are clear & printed directly on the mask so no need to keep pamphlet nearby. Thera-pearls seems to be holding together as well. Looking forward to many more uses.
customer_reviews.author: somemorestuff

customer_reviews.title: Dry eyes after diuretics
customer_reviews.text: I started having dry eyes after starting to take a diuretic for hypertension, and my optometrist said my glands were blocked. She recommended I use a warm washcloth for a couple minutes to help unplug the ducts and get the tears moving again. This is much less messy though and really works perfectly as well as being a low-cost option. My dad has a similar problem and asked me to order him one too!
customer_reviews.author: Halibut Cheeks

customer_reviews.title: It’s a life saver if you get migraines, provides some immediate relief
customer_reviews.text: The straps are a little uncomfortable with the way it pushes against my eyeballs. Aside from that it’s saved me through many migraines.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie

customer_reviews.title: Really helps
customer_reviews.text: Really helps my extremely dry eyes. I try to use daily. I microwave 15 seconds (1000 watt microwave) and leave it on for about 10 minutes or until it starts getting cool again. After I use it my eyes immediately feel so refreshed and moist. I just wish that feeling lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi m

customer_reviews.title: Great for folks with dry eye conditions!
customer_reviews.text: Just what the eye doctor ordered...really. I have chronic severe dry eye and even with twice daily Restasis and frequent OTC eye drops still suffer symptoms frequently. When I had my eyes examined in January, the opthamologist suggested I get a warm compress eye mask, specifically this one... B & L Therapearl. It's so easy to use and it really does work!
customer_reviews.author: InternetMom13

customer_reviews.title: Not brand advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't Bausch & Lomb brand or color indicated in photo and description. Very small, looks like for a child. Took over a month to arrive! Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: ItalGal

customer_reviews.title: Great hot n cold eye mask
customer_reviews.text: Great eye mask. Just be careful with microwave heating times. Use about 2/3 recommended time. Cooling is less sensitive. Holds hot and cold for a good 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Russ from Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: I love this eye mask
customer_reviews.text: I think this is probably the best purchase I've made from Amazon. Very happy with the price, I would definitely recommend and purchase more items from this company. I have constant headaches and sinus issues and this mask puts me right to sleep. I use it every night going to bed. It freezes quickly and stays cold.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This mask has more of those little beads than other masks offered at a retail store. It holds it shape better and maintains heat longer. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy L. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: It gets cold, but doesn't stay cold.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these masks so I could rotate them if they got warm. I should have bought more, not because they're good, but because they're bad. They get very cold, cold to the point of being uncomfortable, once they warm up to the right temperature they don't hold it for long. In less than 20 minutes they're room temperature. The product itself is full of air as well and the plastic it's made out of feels weird on my skin. Over all it does what it's supposed to, be cold or warm. But if you need it for more than a few minutes I'd suggest a trying a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. These are too small to fit over ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. These are too small to fit over the eyes. The heat in the beads doesn't last long. The beads are encased in a flimsy plastic casing. This thing is going to leak soon, I'm certain. Maybe that's the design, so people will continue buying them. I'm not happy at all with this product. I recommend finding something else that is more substantial and better built.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected and also Broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cool down my eyes from long hours of study but unfortunatelt it broke in less than a month. It tore from the side and the blue beads started to fall out onto my face. Very dissapointing. Also, the mask itself is a bit small. It covers the eye but nothing beyond. I wanted to ease my bags under my eyes but due to the small size, it doesn't reach to that area.
customer_reviews.author: T.I.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Love the little beads, but the mask itself is too small for an adult. It doesn't cover the outer corners of my eyes. Plus I would prefer a soft cotton-ish material on my face instead of the soft plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn P

customer_reviews.title: Thera pearl does things right.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little product. Thera pearl is specialized in hot/cold packs, they're arguably the go to brand, and I'm a big fan. If you're somewhere hot or you've slept very little and your eyes have too much fire, use this cold from the freezer to energize you in moments; if you're somewhere cold or have a headache, warm this in your microwave and relax. Good medicine.
customer_reviews.author: Flex

customer_reviews.title: Soothing mask
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can heat or chill this mask depending on what you need. I get awful headaches and this mask definitely helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Bmilner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: So fun for me when I got a Stye. Its like a pimple on the inner of your eye lid and it hurts. I used this as a heat pack and it really helped with the swelling. The pack stayed warm for about 10-15 minutes. it was comfortable to wear and my swelling went down in a day because of this. I have read reviews about the beads bursting so I bought two. One for the freezer and one for the heat only. I am hoping that will stop the bursting issue. If they do burst, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: My Bestfriend
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I've purchased. The only reason I've had to purchase so many is my own fault. When it was too cold I dropped it and cracked it and another time I overheated it. As long as you pay attention this thing is amazing. After I've been outside overheating I pull this out of the freezer and lay down with it. Or more importantly when I have a headache...take some ibuprofen and lay down with this on. I absoulutely love it and will keep purchasing if I'm clumsy again.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is constantly in my freezer for when I get migraines. I put it under my "eye bra" (as my husband calls it) and it holds it in place. Just having that cool sensation over my eyes in the midst of such pain eases it some. My father also gets migraines and I gave him one for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: JenB

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I need this to help with my dry-eye syndrome, and I can honestly say when I don't use it, my eyes get mad. Be careful though, and don't over-heat the mask as it can get way too hot for your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s made for it just doesn’t stay ice cold for a long time, it’s hard for it to since it’s more so frozen gel balls that defrost quickly while on your hot face. But it worked wonders for my migraines
customer_reviews.author: Kandice

customer_reviews.title: Back to the drawing board
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really small and has a tiny band that barley fits around your head. It's just not comfortable to wear at all. It's a shame because I get bad migraines and this does help a little but I know it would work better if I could lay down and relax but I can not due to how uncomfortable this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Soothing for heavy watery eyes!
customer_reviews.text: Lub this! I have alergies, and this help with watery eyes and the dark bags (cold frozen). Advice to us a layer of tissue when compressing. 15mins. Is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Red9

customer_reviews.title: Soothing heat for dry eyes
customer_reviews.text: When my eyes feel dry, I pop this into the microwave for 20 seconds. The soothing heat from these beads helps a lot. It does hold heat well so don’t overheat it. It’s like a mini spa moment whenever you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann G. Rosas

customer_reviews.title: Doctor's Orders
customer_reviews.text: It helps with any eyelid swelling that might occur. Check with your eye doctor.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I heat it and wrap a wet paper towel around it to prevent styes in my eyelids. Works well, stays warm longer than a washcloth etc.
customer_reviews.author: megawatt

customer_reviews.title: Great relief for irritated eyes
customer_reviews.text: Great for dry eyes as well as for allergies. The strap keeps it on snug. Heats up fast, but takes 4 hours to freeze in the freezer. If you have allergies and have itchy eyes, this will provide relief on the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: arfreeze

customer_reviews.title: Good for heat application, but heat doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Works well to heat and moisturize eyes, but the heat lasts only about 5-6 minutes. I didn't heat it in the microwave, though, but by placing in water I boiled and set aside for 3-4 minutes. Wish the heat lasted longer, but otherwise it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan. Very heavy and will not stay in place when I lie down.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Flake

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this eye mask to treat a chalazion. ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this eye mask to treat a chalazion. I warmed it in the microwave for 10 seconds. It stays warm long much longer and works quicker than a wet cloth or rice. Plus you don't have to hold it in place. The key to getting rid of the chalazion is frequent application so the oils stay soft and are able to drain. I only needed the mask on one eye so I placed it on at an angle and was able to wear it while I went about my day.
customer_reviews.author: T. Howzer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it has tiny beads because it is easier to form to your eye area. Solid gel ones don't form as well and are too stiff when frozen. This is pliable when frozen and comfy to wear. I also liked the fact that it was reasonably priced and a trusted brand name.
customer_reviews.author: dlszonn

customer_reviews.title: Eye mask
customer_reviews.text: Love the product! Eye doctor suggested wearing one of theses and I'm so happy I bought this one. Fits very comfortable. I relax so much I nearly fall asleep whwn I wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanman05

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! I'm pleased every time and have never received one with mostly air the way other folks have commented about. My dry eye doctor told me I should use it daily and I do. I leave it in the microwave for roughly 15 seconds. Leaving it in longer will stretch it out, or explode it like mine did when I forgot; leaving my micro with beautiful blue beads.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara J. Hufford-Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great for my frequent headaches
customer_reviews.text: I get frequent headaches around my eyes and forehead, and get frustrated trying to keep a regular ice pack on my forehead when I lay down, so this was the answer to my prayers. Works like a charm. I just wrap it in a soft napkin because it's just a little too cold for me to have directly on my eyelids. Otherwise it's great.
customer_reviews.author: caffeinatedpenguin

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The actual mask is on the small but perfectly functional however it fits on the head very snugly...and I have a small head. I couldn't use it without a good deal of pressure on my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: coppertop

customer_reviews.title: Bad reaction
customer_reviews.text: This mask messed up my eyes. I kept the mask in the refrigerator (not freezer), and I didn’t put it directly on my eyes. Instead I put a tissue between it and my eyes. After a couple of weeks of use, I developed a reaction to it. My eyelids got itchy, red, swollen and crusty, and after a few weeks of not using it my eyes have still not completely healed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer #4583242

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! I've been getting really dry eyes since I ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! I've been getting really dry eyes since I had lasik and I use the heating function of this mask. It really helps to release the oils my eyes need to stay lubed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not kool
customer_reviews.text: They don't feel comfortable and not save the cooler temps to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: adfoxie

customer_reviews.title: Working out great!
customer_reviews.text: I have eye allergies, thus some swelling and discomfort feeling like a foreign body in eye. In addition to using drops prescribed by opthomologist, I'm using this cold compress twice a day. It's very soothing and very comfortable. I keep it in the freezer where it''s ready to go. It arrived nicely packaged and on time. Very happy with this product and buying experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gnome_de_plume

product_meta.title: TheraPearl Eye Mask, Eye-ssential Mask with Flexible Gel Beads for Hot Cold Therapy, Best Spa Eye Wrap for Puffy Eyes, Non Toxic Compress for Swollen Eyes, Relaxation, Hot Cold Ice Pack
product_meta.description: Color:Blue (Old Version)Eye-ssential for tired, puffy eyes, tender brows and aching heads! Even after a restful night’s sleep you can wake with red, puffy eyes that make you look and feel tired –especially during allergy season. If decongestants leave you in a fog, try THERA°PEARL’s Eye-ssential Eye Mask, the natural way to look and feel brighter every day. The mask can be used cold or hot. Cold relieves dry, puffy eyes and those wicked sinus headaches. It takes the sting out of a brow wax and reduces swelling after a cosmetic procedure. Heat helps to reduce nasal congestion and relieves soreness once the swelling is gone. Chill it in the freezer or fridge or pop it into the microwave. Place it over your eyes and sinuses, or slide it up to your forehead. Its pliable, face-hugging shape stays put without drips or leaks, and the therapeutic temperature lasts 20 delicious minutes. You won’t believe the comfort.
feature_bullets: Perfect for dry eyes/allergies, headaches/sinuses, puffy eyes and more
Easily freeze for two hours to feel cooling relief or microwave for 10-15 seconds for penetrating heat
Reusable hot and cold compress with gel pearls that conveniently hold temperature for the doctor-recommended time of approximately 20 minutes
For product longevity, store reusable pack in an airtight container or bag in the freezer
Non-latex BPA-free phthalate-free, mask measures 9" x 2.75"

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
